definition: to cascade down/to flow in torrents/(fig.) outpouring (of emotions)
to overturn/to collapse/to lean/to tend/to incline/to pour out
to leak (of water or gas)/to drip/to drain/to discharge/to leak out/to divulge (secrets)/to give vent (to anger, spite etc)/to disperse/to reduce

sentences.english: Sidewalk vendors use banks of speakers to pour out reggae music at an ear-thumping volume.
sentences.chinese: 街边小贩用一排麦克风倾泄震耳欲聋的瑞格舞音乐。

sentences.english: Don't confide your anger or your grief to your child.
sentences.chinese: 别把你的怒气或怨念倾泄到孩子身上。

sentences.english: As the old ceiling is ripped out, decades of accumulated dust and dirt falls down .
sentences.chinese: 奋力拆除的天花板，倾泄而下的是经年累月的尘土。

definition: to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
(of a watercourse) to breach its dike/(of dikes) to collapse
to gush/to squirt/to surge/to well out/to overflow
to gush/to gush out/to pour out
to flow at great speed/to pour/racing current
to carry along/to carry on one's person/to carry secretly
loud sound, such as that of thunder or a bomb/to rumble/to roar
